definition: small capital, huge profit (idiom); to put in a little and get a lot out
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
root/stem/origin/source/this/the current/original/inherent/originally/classifier for books, periodicals, files etc
surname Wan
ten thousand/a great number
sharp/favorable/advantage/benefit/profit/interest/to do good to/to benefit
surname Li

sentences.english: However, natural stage there is no "lucrative" and fecundity .
sentences.chinese: 然而，舞臺演出天生沒有“一本萬利”的繁殖力。

sentences.english: Nantes had its profitable slave trade reduced to nothing.
sentences.chinese: 南特港一本萬利的奴隸貿易幾乎完全停止。

old but still full of vitality (idiom)
to be promoted and gain wealth (idiom)
the fabled roc flies ten thousand miles (idiom)/one's future prospects are brilliant

promotion to the nobility (idiom)
to get rid of the old to bring in the new (idiom); to innovate
abundant harvest of all food crops/bumper grain harvest

authority over the household
ushering in wealth and prosperity (idiom and traditional greeting, esp. at New Year); We wish you wealth and success!

to think for oneself and act accordingly (idiom); to act on one's own initiative
